prompt: <description>**Part 1: A rectangular metal bar with four holes evenly spaced along its length** **Sketch on face 1:** 1. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.7312, 0), a mid point at (0.7445, 0.0055), and an end point at (0.75, 0.0188). 4. Draw a line from (0.75, 0.0188) to (0.75, 0.1312). 5. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.75, 0.1312), a mid point at (0.7445, 0.1445), and an end point at (0.7312, 0.15). 6. Draw a line from (0.7312, 0.15) to (0.0188, 0.15). 7. Draw an arc with a start point at (0.0188, 0.15), a mid point at (0.0055, 0.1445), and an end point at (0, 0.1312). 8. Draw a line from (0, 0.1312) to (0, 0.0188). *There are 8 curves in total.* 9. Draw a circle with a center at (0.075, 0.075) and a radius of 0.0195 for loop 2. 10. Draw a circle with a center at (0.2625, 0.075) and a radius of 0.0195 for loop 3. 11. Draw a circle with a center at (0.4875, 0.075) and a radius of 0.0195 for loop 4. 12. Draw a circle with a center at (0.675, 0.075) and a radius of 0.0195 for loop 5. *Each loop consists of 1 circle.* **Extrusion:** 13. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 14. Extrude the sketch by 0.0375 units along the normal direction and 0 units opposite the normal direction. The final shape of part 1 is a rectangular metal bar with a length of 0.75 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0375 units. The shape has four holes evenly spaced along its length.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole** *Shape and Dimensions* The shape to be constructed is a cylindrical object with a hole in the center. The object is symmetrical and has a flat base. The hole is located in the center of the cylinder. The object is made of a solid material. The length, width, and height of each intermediate part and the final shape are provided in the JSON. For this part, the length, width, and height are 0.75, 0.75, and 0.1138 units, respectively. *Constructing the Coordinate System* Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotations or translations. *Creating the Sketch* 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw two circles for the outer and inner boundaries of the cylindrical object, with centers at (0.1707, 0.1707) and radii of 0.1707 and 0.0569 units, respectively, for the outer circle, and the same center and radius for the inner circle. 3. Create the base by drawing two circles on the XY plane, centered at (0.1707, 0.5793) with radii of 0.1707 and 0.0569 units. 4. Draw the sidewalls by creating two loops for the outer and inner surfaces as follows: - Loop 1: the outer surface 1. Arc starting at (0.1707, 0.3413), midpoint at (0.2913, 0.2913), and ending at (0.3413, 0.1707) 2. Line connecting (0.3413, 0.1707) to (0.3413, 0.5793) 3. Arc starting at (0.3413, 0.5793), midpoint at (0.2913, 0.4587), and ending at (0.1707, 0.4087) 4. Line connecting (0.1707, 0.4087) to (0.1707, 0.3413) - Loop 2: the inner surface (similar to Loop 1, but the arcs and lines are smaller) *Extruding the Sketch* 1. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 2. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the same coordinate system (no rotations or translations). 3. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.1138 units to create the 3D body. 4. The boolean operation is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation", meaning the current part is a new, separate body.</description>

<description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.0057 units to create the 3D model. This completes the instructions for both parts. prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional, angular, metallic object with a pointed tip** The first part is a three-dimensional, angular, metallic object with a pointed tip. You'll need to create a new coordinate system based on the provided Euler angles and translation vector, and then proceed to create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane before transforming it into 3D using extrusion. *Coordinate system* Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0163, 0.0469, 0.0] *2D Sketch* On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, create a sketch with a single face. Within this face, create multiple loops with lines and arcs: - Loop 1 (face\\_1) - Line 1 - Start Point: [0.0314, 0.1563] - End Point: [0.1712, 0.0] - Line 2 - Start Point: [0.1712, 0.0] - End Point: [0.29, 0.0] - Arc 1 - Start Point: [0.29, 0.0] - Mid Point: [0.4524, 0.0937] - End Point: [0.6148, 0.0] - Line 3 - Start Point: [0.6148, 0.0] - End Point: [0.7337, 0.0] - Line 4 - Start Point: [0.7337, 0.0] - End Point: [0.7337, 0.2812] - Line 5 - Start Point: [0.7337, 0.2812] - End Point: [0.7337, 0.4687] - Line 6 - Start Point: [0.7337, 0.4687] - End Point: [0.6399, 0.4687] - Line 7 - Start Point: [0.6399, 0.4687] - End Point: [0.4524, 0.2812] - Line 8 - Start Point: [0.4524, 0.2812] - End Point: [0.2649, 0.4687] - Line 9 - Start Point: [0.2649, 0.4687] - End Point: [0.1712, 0.4687] - Arc 2 - Start Point: [0.1712, 0.4687] - Mid Point: [0.0, 0.3578] - End Point: [0.0314, 0.1563] Please note that all loops should be closed, and the example provided contains nine lines and two arcs. *3D Sketch (Extrusion)* Once you have completed the 2D sketch, you can transform it into 3D using extrusion. Extrude the sketch in both the direction normal and opposite normal. - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0234 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0234 *Parameters and Operation* Apply the dimensioning as per the sketch scale (0.7337) and perform a Boolean operation that joins this part with the preceding CAD models as it is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation." Remember to record the length, width, and height. - Length: 0.7337 - Width: 0.0469 - Height: 0.7337 With these instructions, you should be able to generate the first part of the CAD assembly based on JSON input. Repeat the process for additional parts and ensure you maintain consistent naming conventions throughout. For more information about CAD modeling with JSON or NC programming, feel free to explore our other tutorials on VLM and the CADPi suite.</description>

Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.7412] c. Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.7412], End Point [0.0, 0.7412] d. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.7412], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Scale the Sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the sketch in the direction of the new coordinate system Z-axis by a depth of 0.1009 units. The resulting extrusion should have the following properties: * Extrusion Depth Towards Normal: 0.1009 * Extrusion Depth Opposite Normal: 0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body Dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.1009 * Height: 0.75 Intermediate Part Summary: The first part is complete. It is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height is half the length of the sides.</description>
